abstract: There is no choice but to ration health care. A commentary by Norman Ornstein offers yet another example. The choice is how to ration.
snippet: There is no choice but to ration health care. A commentary by Norman Ornstein offers yet another example. The choice is how to ration.
lead_paragraph: Opposition to health-care rationing is a little like opposition to growing up. It sounds great. It’s just not very practical.

headline.main: I’ll Never Ration. Not Me. Not I.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
